sect1.title: Keeping the System Up-to-date
sect1.para: openSUSE offers a continuous stream of software security patches for your product. The update applet informs you about the availability of patches and lets you easily install them with just a few clicks.

sect2.title: Using the KDE Software Updater
sect2.para: The Software Updater icon resides in the system tray of your panel depicting a gearwheel with a green arrow. To start Software Updater manually, choose System Settings Software Management Software Updates from the main menu. Alternatively, press F2 and enter kpk_update.

note.title: Icon Visibility
note.para: The Software Updater icon is only visible in the system tray, if patches are available. Hover over the icon to see the number of patches available.

sect3.title: Installing Patches

step.para: Whenever software updates are available, the applet icon appears in the panel. Left-click the Software Updater icon to launch the Review and Update software window.

Select a patch for installation by ticking its checkbox. Get detailed information on a patch by clicking on its title. To select all available patches for installation, tick the checkbox in the table header.
Click Apply to start the patch installation.

In case you have started the patch installation for the first time, you will be asked to enter the root password twice in order to proceed. If you also check Remember authorization you will never be asked again to provide the password.
The Additional Changes window showing an installation summary opens. Click Continue to finish the installation.

sect3.para: The YaST Online Update offers advanced features to customize the patch installation. Please refer to for more information.

sect3.title: Configuring the KDE Software Updater
sect3.para: By default Software Updater checks for updates every 24 hours, notifies you when patches are available and does not automatically install patches. These settings can be changed with the Software Management settings. To open the Software Management settings choose System Settings Software Management Settings from the main menu. Alternatively, press F2 and enter kpk_settings. The settings for Software Updater are available in the Update Settings section.

important.title: Patch Origin
important.para: The Software Management settings also allows you to configure the repositories (Origin of Packages) to be used. This setting not only applies to Software Updater but also to the KDE Software Management module (Get and Remove Software).
Make sure the repository Updates for openSUSE 12.3 is always selectedâ€”otherwise you will not receive patches.

sect2.title: Using the GNOME Update Applet
sect2.para: The update applet resides in the notification area of the panel. Its icon changes depending on the availability and relevance of patches and the status of the update. To invoke the applet manually, choose Computer More Applications System Software Update .

note.title: Icon visibility
note.para: The applet icon is only visible if the following conditions are met:

listitem.para: the GUI was not started as user root
the GUI was not started in a VNC session

note.para: To start the update viewer even if no applet icon is visible, press F2 and enter gpk-update-viewer.

listitem.para: The update applet is busy (for example checking for updates or installing software).

sect3.title: Installing Patches

procedure.title: Installing Patches
procedure.para: Whenever new patches are available, a notification message will appear and the Update Applet icon will be visible in the notification area.

step.para: Either click Install updates in the notification message or click the icon to open the Software Update window.

All security and important patches are preselected. It is strongly recommended to install these patches. Trivial patches can be manually selected by ticking the respective check boxes. Get detailed information on a patch by clicking on its title.
Click Install Updates to start the patch installation.
The Additional Confirmation Required window showing an installation summary opens. Click Continue to proceed.
Enter the root password in the authentication screen and proceed with Authenticate.

sect3.para: The YaST Online Update offers advanced features to customize the patch installation. Please refer to for more information.

sect3.title: Configuring the Software Update Applet
sect3.para: To configure the update applet, right-click the update icon in the panel and choose Preferences. The configuration dialog lets you modify the following settings:

listitem.para: Choose how often a check for updates is performed: Hourly, Daily, Weekly, or Never.
Configure whether patches are installed automatically or not (default). Automatic installation can be chosen for either security patches only or for all patches.
Choose how often a check for major upgrades is performed: Daily, Weekly, or Never.

varlistentry.term: Check for updates when using mobile broadband

listitem.para: This configuration option is only available on mobile computers. Turned off by default.

sect3.para: More options are configurable using gconf-editor: apps gnome-packagekit.
